full_text:
Case 21-58, Document 39-2, 04/01/2021, 3068530, Page82 of 200
19
1  Our process going forward, as we noted in that letter
2  to victims, is that we will use an opt-in process so we will
3  not notify individuals who do not wish to receive additional
4  notifications but will continue to provide ongoing information
5  about upcoming conferences and relevant details on the
6  government's victim services website.
7
8  With respect to this specific hearing, the government
9  has been advised by counsel to three victims of their interest
10  in being heard in connection with today's bail proceeding. One
11  victim's views are expressed in the government's reply
12  memorandum; one victim has submitted a statement to the
13  government and asked that the government read it during today's
14  proceedings; and one victim has asked to be heard directly, and
15  the government anticipates that she will make a statement at
16  any time during this proceeding as necessitated by the court.
17
18  THE COURT: All right. Thank you.
19  Then, with that, returning to the schedule that you
20  have laid out, and I thank counsel for conferring in advance,
21  as to a proposed schedule, Mr. Cohen, let me just finalize if
22  you agree to the proposed schedule that has been laid out by
23  Ms. Moe and supplemented by you?
24  MR. COHEN: Yes, your Honor.
25  THE COURT: All right. Thank you.
26  And, Ms. Moe, you continue to support the proposed
27  schedule?
28
29  SOUTHERN DISTRICT REPORTERS, P.C.
30  (212) 805-0300
31  DOJ-OGR-00019941

text_blocks.content:
1  Our process going forward, as we noted in that letter
2  to victims, is that we will use an opt-in process so we will
3  not notify individuals who do not wish to receive additional
4  notifications but will continue to provide ongoing information
5  about upcoming conferences and relevant details on the
6  government's victim services website.
7
8  With respect to this specific hearing, the government
9  has been advised by counsel to three victims of their interest
10  in being heard in connection with today's bail proceeding. One
11  victim's views are expressed in the government's reply
12  memorandum; one victim has submitted a statement to the
13  government and asked that the government read it during today's
14  proceedings; and one victim has asked to be heard directly, and
15  the government anticipates that she will make a statement at
16  any time during this proceeding as necessitated by the court.
17
18  THE COURT: All right. Thank you.
19  Then, with that, returning to the schedule that you
20  have laid out, and I thank counsel for conferring in advance,
21  as to a proposed schedule, Mr. Cohen, let me just finalize if
22  you agree to the proposed schedule that has been laid out by
23  Ms. Moe and supplemented by you?
24  MR. COHEN: Yes, your Honor.
25  THE COURT: All right. Thank you.
26  And, Ms. Moe, you continue to support the proposed
27  schedule?

additional_notes: The document appears to be a court transcript with a clear and legible format. There are no visible redactions or damage.
